checklist_name: Checklist from Ship Recycling Facility Plan Output
output_report_title: Ship Recycling Facility Plan Compliance Report

requirements.requirement: Verify the revision date and number, and confirm that the SRF board has approved it with a signature.
Check each revision with description of changes.
Ensure only trained workers are working, training records are appended in the SRFP.
Training for all personnel including contractual personnel.
Appropriate training prior performing job as per Training need assessment.
Training Plan (Yearly) with planned and actual completion dates.
Minimum training modules, Inhouse trainer’s pool.
Compulsory regulatory training (18% firefighting, rescue training by Fire service and civil defense).
Personnel files are to be maintained for each worker and management staff so all personnel records can be maintained.
SRF maintains worker’s register working onboard or in the yard.
A Person on Board (PoB) card or any other equivalent system is in use to assist during emergency evacuation.
Facility Information have been included in SRFP.
Location Map is included in SRFP.
DIEF approved Layout plan is included in the SRFP.
SRF arrangement has been included in SRFP.
HAZMAT rooms arrangement been included in SRFP.
All Safety Equipment included in SRFP.
SRF’s permit, license (validity and scope) as applicable to prove that the Facility is operated and maintained in a manner that complies with all applicable laws and regulations.
Visitor management (in yard and on board) specially vendor management including Visitor’s Familiarization.
Safe access and exit at all times during demolition.
Arrival preparation including barricading open spaces.
Ladder safety arrangement is explained in SRFP.
Emergency Securing arrangement of the vessel.
Risk assessment covering all activities during recycling.
Report after completion of ship recycling.
Worker health and safety - Check the OSH practices in general.
Check the competency of competent personnel.
Identification of the team members of risk assessment team.
Full risk assessment procedure and review procedure.
Documentation for safe for entry procedures.
Maintain safe working condition prior, during work in the enclosed spaces.
Permit system with inclusion of all entry parameters.
Safe for entry criteria as per MEPC Guidelines.
Competent person for Safe-for-entry determination- To measure the atmosphere and monitor continuously.
Safe-for-entry determination by a Competent person.
Safe-for-entry certificate, warning signs and labels.
Safe-for-hot-work certificate, warning signs and labels.
Prevention of falling from heights and accidents caused by falling objects.
Gear and equipment for rigging and materials handling.
Maintenance and decontamination of tools and equipment.
Fire and explosion prevention, detection and response.
Identification, marking and labelling and potential on-board locations.
Environmentally sound management of Hazardous Materials.
Anti-fouling compounds and systems (organotin compounds including tributyltin (TBT)).
Hazardous liquids, residues and sediments (such as oils, bilge, and ballast water).
Heavy metals (lead, mercury, cadmium and hexavalent chromium).
Prevention of adverse effects to the environment.
